page.title: 08Churches in Hunton
page.content:
{St.John's Church of England. It stands in an isolated position next to Church Bank. It is a chapel of ease and is registered only for baptisms or funerals. About 10 people regularly go to services. Last year they succeeded in raising Â£1400 for urgent interior repairs. You will find the cemetery at Patrick Brompton,the parish church.
{St.Teresa's:1932-1981 Sadly this small Roman Catholic church was closed by its trustees in 1981 despite protestations by several of the members. Those who are descendants of John.T.Lockey, a villager who left money in his will for the erection of St.Teresa's, are sorry to see it lying empty. Caravanners used to swell their numbers in summer. Now they worship at Aiskew or elsewhere. Soon the building will be demolished by a new owner.
